CatDescriptText: Artist Henry Ossawa Tanner (1859-1937) was born in Pittsburgh, studied at the Philadelphia Academy of Fine Arts, and settled in Paris. He painted "Christ and His Mother" in 1910.  Edgar J. Kaufmann donated the painting to the Y.M.C.A. in 1941.Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 17, 1945, pg. 9, reads: "[illegible] Parade - These members of the Smart Young Set are just waiting  for March 20 to roll around.  They are all ready to parade in Beauty Shop Owners' Fashion Show, which will be held in Schenley High School Auditorium.  Left to right: Bertha Boyd, Hattie Beverly, Edmonia [J?]ones, Sallie Brown, Dorcas Glascoe, Jean Goode and Elleenes Inabinet. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of beauty shop owners, from left: Bertha Boyd, Hattie Beverly, Edmonia Jones, Sallie Brown, Dorcas Glascoe, Jean Goode, and Elleenes Inabinet, posed in Centre Avenue YMCA with Henry O. Tanner painting "Christ and His Mother"
